alert.note: Alert for Custer; Northern Rosebud (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:58PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Custer and northern Rosebud Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 557 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Miles City, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail, wind gusts in excess of 40 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Torrential rainfall may lead to localized flooding and ponding of water on roadways. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Custer and northern Rosebud Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
